articles.description: Ireland retain the Six Nations by beating Scotland in Dublin, a result that ends England's hopes of snatching the title.
articles.title: Ireland beat Scotland to retain Six Nations title

articles.description: Tottenham "didn't put in the effort" and need a "big wake-up call" after their defeat by Fulham at Craven Cottage, says captain Son Heung-min.
articles.title: 'Unacceptable' Spurs 'didn't put the effort in' - Son

articles.description: Thomas Ramos kicks the winning penalty from the halfway line as France edge England in a seven-try thriller to finish second in the 2024 Six Nations.
articles.title: Late Ramos penalty sees France beat England in thriller

articles.description: Xander Schauffele will take a one-shot lead into Sunday's final round of the Players Championship over Wyndham Clark, while Matt Fitzpatrick is four back.
articles.title: Players Championship: Xander Schauffele leads Wyndham Clark, Matt Fitzpatrick in contention

articles.description: Manchester City cruise into the FA Cup semi-finals with a comfortable victory over a jaded and disappointing Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium.
articles.title: Man City dispatch Newcastle to reach FA Cup semis

articles.description: The woman in the Christian Horner controversy lodges an official complaint about his behaviour with Formula 1's governing body, the FIA.
articles.title: Christian Horner accuser lodges official complaint with FIA about his behaviour

articles.description: Italy beat Wales in Cardiff to achieve their most successful Six Nations and consign their hosts to their first Wooden Spoon in 21 years.
articles.title: Italy consign Wales to first Wooden Spoon in 21 years

articles.description: Harry Kane sets a new personal best of 31 league goals in a season as Bayern Munich beat Darmstadt in the Bundesliga.
articles.title: Kane sets league best as Bayern beat Darmstadt

articles.description: Celtic beat St Johnstone to return to the top of the Scottish Premiership, with Rangers inactive until Sunday.
articles.title: Celtic back on top after defeat of St Johnstone

articles.description: Belgium's Jasper Philipsen wins the fastest-ever Milan-San Remo race in a photo finish on Saturday.
articles.title: Milan-San Remo: Belgium's Jasper Philipsen wins from Michael Matthews in photo finish
